meanings.definition: 欧州石炭鉄鋼共同体 (European Coal and Steel Community)
meanings.english_definition: European Coal and Steel Community: an organization of European countries set up after World War II to regulate their industrial production under central control.

examples.sentence: The ECSC was a precursor to the European Union.
examples.translation: ECSCは欧州連合の前身であった。

etymology.value: The European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC) was established by the Treaty of Paris in 1951.
